channel.title: ::starter command doesnt work correctly

item.title: ::starter command doesnt work correctly
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

first, check your client.java and make sure that the starter isn’t activated anyways. to find it out, just get your welcome message and search for it. that’s where the server defines what happens when a new account is created. look for anything saying starter = 1 and if you find it delete it. if you don’t find it then idk, you might have to add it so it does an automatic starter.

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter command doesnt work correctly
item.dc:creator: @beazy beazy
item.description:
@beazy wrote:

well it really doesnt matter, id rather make it a command lol.

but I got it to work.i didnt know the starter given upon login screwed up the command. i deleted the login starter and now the command works fine.

item.title: ::starter command doesnt work correctly

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Make sure that when you register a new account on the server the starter command is not activated automatically.

item.title: ::starter command doesnt work correctly
item.dc:creator: @beazy beazy
item.description:
@beazy wrote:

hey all I just started coding yesterday and it’s all pretty easy. I already know how to add npcs, make objects, make monster drops, change item bonuses and such. But im having trouble with commands. Particularly the ::starter command. Im having a lot of trouble getting it to be able to be used only once.

This is what my code currently looks like:

}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 5000000);
addItem(1321, 1);
addItem(841, 1);
addItem(882, 150);
addItem(558, 150);
addItem(556, 150);
sM(“Beazyscape starter kit. Enjoy!”);
starter = 1;
} else if (starter == 1) {
sM(“Sorry, you already have your starter kit.”);
}

}

If someone could help me figure out what im doing wrong I’d appreciate it.

To clarify, I don’t get an error when I compile, but when I do the command on my server it doesn’t give me the starter kit, it only gives me the second sM as if ive already done it. Ive tried it with plenty of test accounts and it acts like theyve all done it already. So please help me figure out what im doin wrong lol.

Read full topic
